result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J Tillman

records.addlTxt:
State by Donskey in person /  Def appears w/ Atty Krueger in person
Statement of Negotated Plea filed - signed by def / understands
Def plead & sentenced in 20CF133, 20CF32 & 20CM648
THIS CASE IS DISMISSED & READ-IN

State by Wertheimer & Tyler
VT present - wants to lift no contact. 
Court:  DENIED
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

12:01 PM Attorney Rachel Ann Krueger in court for Defendant Justin J Tillman. Prosecuting Atty Susan C Donskey appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Justin J Tillman in court.
State requests Court take judicial notice of bond in effect at time of incident. 
Officer Chad Maske - sworn and testifies:  Gives testimony - Witness identifies defendant.
12:08 pm - X by Krueger:  Gives testimony
12:17 am - Re-direct by Donskey - Gives testimony
Krueger objects to bindover - comments
Donskey requests probable cause finding - comments
Probable cause found - Bindover
Information filed - Reading waived 
Advised of charges/penalties
Def stands mute - NG plea entered
PTC: 7/1/22 @ 2:30 (DA)
STC: 9/1/22 @ 10am (TWB)

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: cont to 4/22 @ 2 and to be first case called

11:24 am   Defendant Justin J Tillman in court with attorney Rachel Ann Krueger. Attorney Susan C Donskey in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
20CF-116 and 20CF-133  Prelim waiver gone over with Def.. No promises/threats.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is F & V made and accepted.  Probable Cause Found - Bound over for Trial
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Pleads NG - NG Pleas entered and also on 20CM-648
PTC: 6/24 at 2:30 pm    STC: 9/1 at 10:00 am   TWB

22CF-311   Complaint filed and a copy given to Atty. Krueger.  R/P advised.
PH:  4/28 at 11:00 am    TWB

Krueger addresses the no contact with VT in 22CF-311.  Kranz:  We've made contact with VT who has some significant injuries.... We'd ask for no bond modifications at this time.  Krueger:  I spoke to VT this morning and told me she wanted the no contact lifted and spoke to the DA's Ofc..  She didn't know if she could make it to court today.  I have her the zoom info......  She helps Mr. Tillman with his issues....  Kranz:  VT is not here due to work issues.  She was knocked unconscious during this event.
COURT comments.  I'm not going to lift it now but she can appear at 2:00 tomorrow if she wishes to.
Tillman states he has no where to live.  Uses a walker....
Court:  See if you can get it on at 2:00 today.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
w/cond: no alcohol, bars or taverns, no contact w/VT and residence, report to JSS for bail monitoring
